result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio P Martinez

records.addlTxt:
10:17 AM Defendant Antonio P Martinez in court.  Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court for Antonio P Martinez.  Attorney Zachary A Wittchow and Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter continues from 6/28/22 motion hearing that had commenced for motion to suppress on case 22CF208.
Deputy US Marshal Grams is sworn in to continue testifying.
Atty Martinez continues to cross examine witness. 
Atty Wittchow asks a few follow up questions. 
Atty Martinez asks a few further questions. 
Atty Wittchow calls Officer B Downey who is sworn in and testifies. 
Atty Martinez cross examines the witness. 
Atty Wittchow calls US Deputy Marshal Loesch who is sworn in and testifies. 
Atty Martinez cross examines the witness. 
State rests. 
Atty Martinez has no witnesses. 
Testimony closed. 
Closing statements given by State. 
Atty Martinez gives closing statements. 
Court takes matter under advisement.  Court will allow parties to file briefs in this matter. 
Atty Martinez requests all other matters tag along with this matter and not go to sentencing on Monday. 
Parties to file written briefs by 12/6/22 
Court will set status for all hearings.
Oral ruling scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on January 9, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Oral ruling on December 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

12:16 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Antonio P Martinez in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Martinez notes that this matter is just tagging along with the defendant's other cases for status.  Also noting that this case is set for a motion hearing before Branch 10 in September.  Court will maintain the previously scheduled Motion hearing before Branch 10 on 09/12/2022 at 10:00.
Motion hearing on September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

03:39 PM Defendant Antonio P Martinez in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Atty Chelsea Thompson along with Atty Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
State files amended information. 
Defense accepts amended information, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas. 

Court addresses the Other acts motion in case 20CF1423. 
Atty Thompson makes a statement as to the other acts motion.
Atty Martinez objects to motion and states reasons on the record. 
Atty Thompson makes further statements to the court. 
Court grants motion and states reasons on the record.  
Court addresses motion to suppress next in case 22CF208. 
All parties are ready to proceed to the motion to suppress. 
Atty Wittchow calls Deputy US Marshal Grams who is sworn in and testifies.  
Atty Martinez cross examines the witness. 
Atty Martinez requests the motion be held and that he obtain all the reports that have been filed and be allowed a copy of them. 
State makes a further statment to the court that they will have to obtain the report themselves. 

Court will reset matter for another day to allow reports to be supplied to all parties.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on July 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

11:04 AM Defendant Antonio P Martinez in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Martinez requests trial remain as set.  
Court addresses the WCS report. 
State makes a statement to the court as to report.
Atty Martinez makes a statement as to report and does provide proof of overtime in this matter. 
Bail remains as set.  
Matter set for motion to suppress and motion to dismiss.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's notice of motion and motion to suppress and dismiss filed by Atty Martinez.
attachment filed by Atty Martinez
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury status hearing on August 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:07 AM Defendant Antonio P Martinez in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests a new date as parties are working on a global resolution.  No victims were present today.  Courts sets all matters for Plea/Sentencing in June and Jury Status in August.  20CF1423 is set for Jury Status and Jury Trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

08:37 AM Defendant Antonio P Martinez in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Martinez requests a plea and sentencing date and has requested further discovery.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:28 AM Defendant Antonio P Martinez in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  City of Waukesha Police Department Detective Justin Rowe sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Wittchow.  Cross examination by Attorney Martinez.  State rests.  State moves for bind over without argument.  Attorney Martinez objects to bind over and moves to dismiss.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Date previously set before the Trial Court shall remain.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
